my nautilus cannot connect to an sftp. gftp can, but i hate gftp. any ideas?
cannot display sftp://keres@satgnu.net error: timed out when logging in. please select another viewer and try again
try upgrade to 8.10 or try the live cd at least, I think they've improved the sftp function a lot
i used to run intrepid, but i need alot of progs that use older versions of gtk. can you run newer nautilus versions without intrepid
I think it's generally risky and not recommended. What do you need the sftp for? Use ftp, it would probably work :) You could also get used to the command line and commands such as scp and sftp :)
it's my website. i don't host it, so the host gave me shell access through sftp.
you can use ftp in nautilus with the same way you use sftp: nautilus ftp://user@yourhost.com
could not display, host not found
er.. did you change the "yourhost.com" and "username" to your host/domain and username?
Well, I believe there's no harm done in asking for an ftp account - it will help you stay on 8.04 :)
